personalProfile.title: Personal Profile
personalProfile.data: I am working as a postdoctoral fellow in Indian Institute of Technology Ropar, India. I have successfully defended my Ph.D. thesis entitled “Computational studies of selected gas hydrates and hydrate melts” under the supervision of Dr. C. N. Ramachandran. My areas of expertize are computational chemistry, quantum chemical studies, electronic structure properties of chemical systems, energy storage and transportation materials, weak interactions, vibrational Raman spectroscopy, nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy, classical molecular dynamics

data.title: Postdoctoral Fellow
data.subTitle2: Dr. T. J. Dhilip Kumar (Associate Professor and Head), IIT-RPR
data.subTitle1: Structure and Properties of Novel Transition Metal Dichalcogenides Nano Sheets

data.title: Ph.D.
data.subTitle2: Dr. Ramachandran C. N. (Assistant Professor), IITR
data.subTitle1: Computation studies of selected gas hydrates and hydrate melts
points: Quantum chemical techniques were used to understand the electronic properties of gas hydrates and variation in the vibrational Raman stretching frequencies and nuclear magnetic resonance frequencies of the guest species with a change in the chemical environment.

For electronic studies, the lowest energy single and fused host water cages were used which were designed by using strong weak hydrogen bond (SWB) and strong weak effective hydrogen bond (SWEB) models.
Investigated the role of weak interactions on the stability of hydrate structures.
Evolution of dissolved gases from the CH4-N2-CO2-H2O liquid phase which has a subsequent effect on the formation of new hydrate was studied by applying classical molecular dynamics simulations.

data.title: M.Sc.
data.subTitle2: Dr. Harsh Manchanda (Associate Professor and Head), NITJ
data.subTitle1: Volumetric Properties of Trisodium Citrate and Tripotassium Citrate in Water and in Aqueous Solutions of N-acetyl Glycine
points: Measured the densities and speed of sound for trisodium citrate and tripotassium citrate in aqueous solutions of N-acetyl glycine at various temperatures.
Evaluated different parameters such as apparent molar volume, limiting apparent molar volume, transfer volume, partial molar expansibility from the density data.
Pair and triple pair interaction coefficients were calculated from transfer parameters.
Ion-ion and ion-solvent interactions were investigated.

data.title: Summer Research Project
data.subTitle2: Dr. Arvind Kumar (Principle Scientist), CSMCRI Bhavnagar
data.subTitle1: Effect of EGMME on the Micellization Behavior of Tx-100 in Aqueous Medium
points: Studied the micellization behavior of ionic liquid (Tx-100) in the presence of ethylene glycol monomethyl ether (EGMME) at various temperatures.
Investigated surface interface interactions before and after micellization

awards.title: Awards
data: 2013 Qualified Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE). GATE is an all India entrance examination conducted jointly by IISC and IITs for Ph.D., M. Tech and PSU admissions.

data: S. P. Kaur, K. S. Sujith and C. N. Ramachandran; Formation of nanobubble and its effect on the structural ordering of water in CH4-N2-CO2-H2O mixture. Phys. Chem. Chem. Phys. 2018, 20, 9157-9166.

S. P. Kaur and C. N. Ramachandran; Hydrogen-Tetrahydrofuran mixed hydrates: A computational study. Int. J. Hydrogen Energy. 2018, 43, 19559-19566.

V. Shilpi, S. P. Kaur and C. N. Ramachandran; Revisiting the structural pattern and stability of (H2O)20 clusters using the dispersion corrected density functional method. Chem. Phys. Lett. 2015, 626, 39-42.

workshops.title: Workshops
data: Attended an ACS on Campus workshop which was held at Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee in February, 2018.
Attended an USPEX 8th workshop which was held at Shiv Nadar University Noida in January, 2015.
Attended Chemistry with computers symposium which was held at IIIT Hyderabad in February, 2014.

conferences.title: Conferences
data: Presented a poster entitled “Effect of cage occupancy on host-guest interaction and spectral properties of guest molecules in fused water cages” at 15th Indian Theoretical Chemistry Symposium (TCS) held at Hyderabad in December, 2017.

Presented a poster entitled “Effect of cage occupancy on spectral properties of guest molecules in fused cages” at Chemical Research Society of India (CRSI) symposium held at Panjab University Chandigarh in February, 2016
